input: Which one among the following is a Fundamental Duties of citizens under the Constitution of India?

options.A: To provide friendly co-operation to the people of the neighbouring countries
options.B: To protect monuments of national importance
options.C: To defend the country and render national service when called upon to do so
options.D: To know more and more about the history of India

explanation: The Forty Second Constitution Amendment Act, 1976 has incorporated ten Fundamental Duties in Article 51(a) of the constitution of India. The 86th Constitution Amendment Act 2002 has added one more Fundamental Duty in Article 51(a) of the constitution of India. As a result, there are now 11 Fundamental Duties of the citizen of India.
